channel.title: Aviator on Sławomir Liszniański
channel.description: Recent content in Aviator on Sławomir Liszniański

item.title: IMC in London, KY
item.description: On March 12th, we flew to Kentucky. Originally, we planned to fly to Knoxville, Tennessee however IMC conditions prevented safe flight to our intended destination. We landed earlier - at KLOZ - and stayed overnight in London, KY. Curtesy of AllTrails, we found an amazing hike to “Pine Island Double Falls”.

item.title: Hurah! I passed the IFR written test
item.description: On my road to IFR cert: log 50 hours of cross-country flight time 40 hours of actual or simulated instrument time, of which 15 must be with a CFII 3 hours in an appropriate airplane and within two calendar months of the checkride an IFR cross-country with an instructor (250NM, an approach at each airport and 3 kinds of approaches)

item.title: Taking old friend for his first flight in Cessna
item.description: My friendship with Rajesh dates back to early 2000. We met at The Options Clearing Corp in Chicago where we both worked as C++ programmers. We’ve always had a lot of fun and hang out together to this day. Other than complaining about the low cabin temperature, Rajesh took it great. In April of 2011, along with 4 awesome people, we took a bike trip through California and Nevada.

item.title: New home: DuPage Airport (KDPA)
item.description: Last week I joined the “International Flying Club” out of DuPage, Illinois. Check them out! My first flight of the week had me tackle 30kts gusts. The wind was strong enough to tilt the camera shortly after take-off, as seen on the video.

item.title: RV-10 build log
item.description: Jan ‘21 - Arrival of parts Truck with parts from Vans and Lycoming Unpacking and inventory checking

item.title: Spinning with GPS overlay
item.description: As part of my spin-recovery training, I had a chance to fly this beautiful Decathlon.
